children.value: % This is a simple sample document.  For more complicated documents take a look in the exercise tab. Note that everything that comes after a % symbol is treated as comment and ignored when the code is compiled.
% \documentclass{} is the first command in any LaTeX code.  It is used to define what kind of document you are creating such as an article or a book, and begins the document preamble
% \usepackage is a command that allows you to add functionality to your LaTeX code
% Sets article title
% Sets authors name
% Sets date for date compiled
% The preamble ends with the command \begin{document}
% All begin commands must be paired with an end command somewhere
% creates title using information in preamble (title, author, date)
% creates a section
Today I am learning
%notice how the command will end at the first non-alphabet charecter such as the . after \LaTeX
is a great program for writing math. I can write in line math such as
Derivative(Add(Pow(Symbol('x'), Integer(2)), Symbol('x')), Tuple(Symbol('x'), Integer(1)))
%$ tells LaTexX to compile as math
. I can also give equations their own space:
% Creates an equation environment and is compiled as math

value: Equality(Add(Pow(Symbol('gamma'), Integer(2)), Pow(Symbol('theta'), Integer(2))), Pow(Symbol('omega'), Integer(2)))
Equality(Symbol('gamma'), Pow(Add(Pow(Symbol('omega'), Integer(2)), Mul(Integer(-1), Pow(Symbol('theta'), Integer(2)))), Rational(1, 2)))

children.value: If I do not leave any blank lines

will continue  this text without making it into a new paragraph.  Notice how there was no indentation in the text after equation (1).  
    Also notice how even though I
Equality(Add(Pow(Symbol('a'), Integer(2)), Pow(Symbol('b'), Integer(2))), Pow(Symbol('c'), Integer(2)))
hit enter after that sentence and here

formats the sentence without any break.  Also   look  how      it   doesn't     matter          how    many  spaces     I put     between       my    words.
    
    For a new paragraph I can leave a blank space in my code.
% This is the end of the document
